author: fundedcrypto
content: On EIP 3651: "ELI5: This plan enables builder-proposer separation and lowers the cost of block construction. As a result, network users will pay less in gas fees, and traders who use builders to carry out complex trades will no longer be responsible for unsuccessful transactions." and then right after he mentioned "As previously mentioned, the Ethereum core team has decided to prioritise the Ethereum Shanghai network update before implementing Surge-related network changes. ". Woudln't PBS be a Surge-related change ? I am missing something here? Source https://medium.com/@CryptoSavingExpert/crypto-101-ethereum-shanghai-upgrade-cfba1d9aa429

author: fundedcrypto
content: From <@552133098075193354> 's Shanghai Q&A, I have figured there will be an ~57k ETH max unstake per day, is this number correct ?

author: timbeiko
content: It's not my Q&A, to be clear ðŸ˜„  I just shared it, but a bunch of people worked on it.

author: timbeiko
content: Worst case withdrawal number (which is unlikely, but, again, worst case) can be derived by the max # of withdrawals per block * max # of blocks per day * max ETH per withdrawal

author: timbeiko
content:
Max Withdrawals per block = 16 (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/capella/beacon-chain.md#execution)
Max blocks per day = 7200 (86400 secs/day & 12s blocks)
Max ETH per withdrawal = 33.98 ETH (current avg. validator balance as per https://beaconcha.in/)

author: timbeiko
content: That said, this number is extremely unlikely: it assumes that all validators are fully withdrawing each block for a day.

author: timbeiko
content: In practice, the vast majority of withdrawals will be partial withdrawals of, right, now, an average of ~2 ETH (33.98 avg. balance - 32 ETH to keep staking). So, you need to make an assumption about the relative % of full vs. partial withdrawals. Say you had something like 90% partial & 10% full, then you'd be at 16x7200x(2x0.9+34x0.1)=599040 per day. If you make it 99/1, then you get 267264.

author: timbeiko
content:
Two more caveats: 

First, the 2 ETH on avg. per partial withdrawal is a "one time anomaly" because of the time since the beacon chain launch. Once the first full sweep has happened, the partial withdrawals will be much lower.

author: timbeiko
content: Second, this doesn't take into account the exit queue, i.e. it assumes that validators are already fully exited. The exit queue dynamics change how many validators could fully exit in a day.

author: fundedcrypto
content: Thank you for the breakdown with all the formulas, going further down into the rabit hole then, what would be the realistic number also taking into account the exit queue dynamics ? I was basing off the ~504k active validators and 1800 max validators per day as suggested in this answer from the FAQ
